CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of LOC in the GPE region .

CARDINAL . In DATE the local authorities undertook to connect the village to a gas pipeline . Starting from DATE the applicant was entrusted with directing the works . According to him , at that point the public funding was interrupted and the construction was continued at the expense of certain villagers . After the GPE completion in DATE the village council and some of the villagers publicly accused the applicant of embezzling public funds , which , as they claimed , had been allocated to him for the construction works in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the village council , as well as against Mr S. and PERSON , seeking compensation for damages in respect of the aforementioned embezzlement accusations considered by him to be defamatory .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Ivanivka Court ” ) allowed the applicant ’s claim in part .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP ORG of Appeal ( “ the NORP Regional Court ” ) quashed the aforementioned judgment and remitted the case back to ORG for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG ( “ the Kominternivskyy Court ” ) .

CARDINAL . The examination of the case was adjourned several times for the followings reasons : the applicant ’s absence or at his lawyer ’s request ( for DATE in total ) ; the adversary party ’s absence ( for DATE ) ; and the judge ’s leave ( for DATE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim , as well as the counterclaim of PERSON which she had lodged in the meantime , as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed that appeal following a hearing , in which the applicant had participated . It was noted in the ruling that it could be appealed in cassation within DATE after its pronouncement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a cassation appeal , together with a request for renewal of the time - limit . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation . He submitted , inter alia , that the adversary party had obtained , without his knowledge , a medical certificate regarding his health which had wrongly been adduced to the case file .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the judge dealing with his case .
